node.title: US spy agencies split on Covid origin theories
node.description: The office that oversees US spy agencies could not establish how the coronavirus pandemic began.

node.title: US to continue Kabul airlift 'until last moment'

node.title: Irish support for Brexit deal 'harming N Ireland'
node.description: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson is meeting Taoiseach Micheál Martin in Dublin to discuss the NI Protocol.

node.title: New Orleans braces for direct hit from hurricane
node.description: Hurricane Ida is forecast to strike as a category 3 hurricane, the same as Katrina exactly 16 years ago.

node.title: Judge blocks Florida governor’s mask mandate ban
node.description: School mask mandates have caused fierce debates across the US as students return and Delta surges.

node.title: Scientists find world's northernmost island

node.title: Pen Farthing through airport security with animals
node.description: The Ministry of Defence said Pen Farthing and his animals are awaiting a flight out of Afghanistan.

node.title: No escape from Afghanistan now, says rescue bid man

node.title: Transcript: The lowdown on being disabled in Japan
node.description: This is a full transcript of The lowdown on being disabled in Japan as first presented by Beth Rose on 26 August 2021.

node.title: Officer who shot Capitol rioter reveals identity

node.title: British nationals killed in Kabul airport attack

node.title: Federal Reserve to start withdrawing US stimulus
node.description: The central bank's chairman says it could slow asset purchases this year but is in no rush to raise rates.

node.title: Kenyans stuck overnight in massive traffic jam

node.title: Afghans prepare to risk lives again to reach UK

node.title: The local people helping Afghan refugees in the UK

node.title: Austrian ex-far-right leader guilty of corruption

node.title: Barnier joins presidential race 'to change France'

node.title: Raab criticised for 'weak response' to Jagtar plea
node.description: The foreign secretary declined to say if he would meet the family of a Scot being held without trial in India.

node.title: 'Overwhelming' response to refugee donation call

node.title: Wanted Thai police chief 'Jo Ferrari' surrenders

node.title: US court blocks Biden's anti-eviction measure

node.title: Afghan Uyghurs fear 'double danger' under the Taliban

node.title: 'My family might be killed or disappeared'

node.title: India student in hospital after gang rape

node.title: The real victims of mass crypto-hacks

node.title: Why rent control isn’t working in Sweden

node.title: UK's Kabul evacuation going at 'significant pace'

node.title: Man missing after emergency landing on French beach

node.title: Japan rollercoaster closed after injuries claims

node.title: Woman who accused MP of rape dies in self-immolation

node.title: Government announces insurance scheme for large summer events
node.description: The government has pledged to cover 90 percent of unrecoverable costs for major events cancelled or postponed due to Covid-19 this summer.

node.title: Police locate man they were seeking in relation to Connor Whitehead death
node.description: Police say the man was taken into custody at a residential address in Avonside at around 5.15pm.

node.title: lWhen Kilauea Erupted, a New Volcanic Playbook Was Written
node.description: Scientists learned lessons from the 2018 outburst on the island of Hawaii that are changing how responders prepare for eruptions in other places.

node.title: Bad blood between Nuggets and Heat after NBA MVP Nikola Jokic blindsides Markieff Morris
node.description: The NBA's Nuggets and Heat clash in Denver over an ugly incident that results in MVP Nikola Jokic and Miami's Markieff Morris being ejected — and a furious Jimmy Butler and other Heat players waiting for the Nuggets outside afterwards.

node.title: Principals work to fill gaps as vaccine-resistant teachers mean staff numbers likely to drop
node.description: Principals are figuring out how to cover classes on Tuesday when staff who have not had at least their first injection are no longer allowed on site.

node.title: Why New York Is Closing 6 Prisons
node.description: The number of people incarcerated in New York is less than half of what it was in 1999, and the facilities being closed are well below capacity.

node.title: Comcast Xfinity Outage Map as Services Come Back Online Across Bay Area
node.description: The Comcast outage map shows large number of customers in San Francisco and the surrounding area were affected.

node.title: 'A bit weird': Limited fizz and finery for Cup Day at Addington
node.description: The biggest party of the year in Christchurch went ahead on Tuesday, despite a ban on spectators at Addington Raceway.

node.title: Protesters deliver anti-lockdown, vaccine messages to government
node.description: Angry visitors arrived at the door of democracy in the capital today, with thousands of protesters marching to Parliament for various Covid-19-related reasons.

node.title: Late Night Goes After Ted Cruz for Going After Big Bird
node.description: Jimmy Kimmel said conservatives like Ted Cruz have some bizarre beliefs: “The elections are rigged, the deep state runs the world, and Big Bird is working for Merck now.”

node.title: Calls for more testing after asbestos found in imported toys and building materials
node.description: Unions and anti-asbestos campaigners are demanding more testing at Australia's border after revelations the deadly mineral is still slipping into the country despite a strict ban.

node.title: Foreign Minister Mahuta to visit six countries in first official overseas trip
node.description: Mahuta is flying out on Thursday for a visit that will take in Australia, Indonesia, the UAE, Qatar, the United States and Canada.

node.title: Qantas A380 soars back to Sydney after gathering dust in desert for more than 500 days
node.description: After more than 500 days gathering dust in storage in the Californian desert, a Qantas A380 superjumbo roars back across Australian skies for the first time since 2020.

node.title: Multiple fatalities after crash south of Levin - police
node.description: Police say there are multiple fatalities after a crash between a truck and a car on State Highway 1, near Kuku in Horowhenua.

node.title: Concerns fire brigades could fold as staff receive vaccine mandate
node.description: Firefighters have been told they must be vaccinated and there are concerns about what emergency coverage will look like when their first deadline passes on Monday.

node.title: Murdered woman Suzanne Poll's husband breaks down in court as he recounts night he found her body
node.description: The husband of a woman murdered in an Adelaide stationery shop nearly three decades ago has broken down in court recalling the moment he discovered his wife's bloodied body in the back storage area of the shop where she worked. The following story contains content some readers may find distressing.

node.title: Scott Morrison isn't undergoing a climate conversion but an awakening to public sentiment
node.description: The Prime Minister is not longer comparing electric vehicles with a war on the weekend. This isn't a climate conversion but an awakening to a changing political landscape, writes political correspondent Brett Worthington.

node.title: Auckland will move to level 3 step 2, Northland to move to level 2
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says Cabinet has agreed to loosen restrictions for Auckland and upper Northland.

node.title: Satellite images show mockups of US Navy ships in Chinese desert
node.description: Satellite images by space tech company Maxar have captured mockups in the shape of US Navy aircraft carriers and other warships in the Chinese desert.

node.title: Nigel Avery takes over as Chef de Mission
node.description: Olympian and five-time Commonwealth Games medallist Nigel Avery is pledging to bring further focus to athlete wellbeing in his role as New Zealand Team Chef de Mission.

node.title: Alec Baldwin calls for police on film sets to monitor gun safety
node.description: Actor Alec Baldwin says he believes film and TV productions should hire police officers to monitor weapons on sets as Hollywood considers new safety measures following the fatal shooting of Halyna Hutchins.

node.title: 'I get goosebumps': Emma Gilmour becomes McLaren's first female driver
node.description: Emma Gilmour says she never imagined she would have the opportunity to race for McLaren as she becomes the renowned team's first female driver.
